page.title: 13Halewood - a typical Sunday.
page.content: A class of 35 eight year olds carried out a survey and wrote about "A Typical Sunday" in their lives to see how children in Halewood use their spare time at the weekend. Most time is spent playing outdoors or watching television. Family activities on Sunday included visits to the swimming baths at Bridgefield Forum (quite a few children), trips out in the car to the seaside or the countryside (a very few children). Although this survey was carried out by the Church of England School only a tiny minority of the class attend church regularly. "Parade Sunday" attracts more church attendance but very few attend on a regular basis. The majority leisure activities seem to be watching T.V. and playing out. There are few recreational facilities for children in the local area.
